bioghist.p: Dimitri Mitropoulos (1896-1960) was a Greek conductor, pianist, and composer who spent most of his career in the United States. Oliver Daniel (1911-1990) was an American arts administrator, musicologist, and composer. Daniel did extensive research on Mitropoulos, including interviews with many of his colleagues and contemporaries. Daniel died before his biography of Mitropoulos was completed. Daniel Ott, the executor of Daniel's estate, asked William Trotter to take over the project. Trotter's book, Priest of Music: The Life of Dimitri Mitropoulos was published by Amadeus Press in 1995.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains research conducted by Oliver Daniel on Dimitri Mitropoulos. The bulk of the collection consists of audiocassette recordings of interviews with musicians who worked with Mitropolous, and transcriptions of those interviews. There are also newspaper clippings, program notes, and biographical information about the interview subjects, and correspondence from Daniel and from Daniel Ott with the interview subjects related to the interviews and the production of the book. There are also photographs and negatives of Mitropolous at work and at leisure and several printed works on Mitropoulos, including a discography, biographies, and commemorative programs. The collection also includes copies of FBI files on Mitropolous.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
